comment: High proof but not aggressive at all except for the very last bit of the finish. Spiced on the nose, great sweet taste. VERY VERY GOOD!!
Stronger and sharper than regular bulleit. Tasty improvement
Awesome   3-27-17. Love Bulliet and this even better.  4.6
Really great.  Only available in KY. Not necessarily smooth.
Heat with red hots. Very smooth with great flavor throughout. Bulleit is a good drinking whiskey and this version allows it to be bold anyway you want to drink it.
Drinks smoother than 120 proof. Hard to pin down but a good product. Better than several other barrel/cask strength options out there.
Bulleit black label - burns, but smoothly.  (120 proof, so duh)

I had the 119.2 & 119 proof both are FANTASTIC, DELICIOUS, & EASY TO DRINK!!! Neat it's great, with a tab bit of water it opens more and is still great, you can add a ice cube and let the whiskey play.  You can use this in cocktails at $60 for 750ml it holds up well🍹🍸🥃🥃🥃
93/100

Batch 02. Relatively light on the nose. Some char and brown sugar. Sweet immediately. Heat next. Some caramelized sugar, pepper, and astringent wood. Some black cherry. Spicy. A little thin. Slight bitterness, maybe cacao, at the end. 8/26/17

I still prefer the original Bulleit as my "daily sipper" of choice, but this is a decent bottle in its own right. Not as good as its high-proof bretheren that I've tasted (Maker's Mark Cask Strength and Booker's come to mind), I still appreciate the tastes that make Bulleit's brands among my early bourbon favorites. The sweet, marshmallowy caramel taste gives way to a smooth, spicy burn, and the fruit tastes at the end linger nicely. It's a solid pickup when I'm in the Kentucky area.

This expression is very sweet and very tasty with virtually no heat. It does not drink like a 119 proof bourbon.  For me this was not nearly as complex as the Bulleit 10 yr., which I find is a superior pour.  If anyone from Bulleit is reading this, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE do a barrel proof version of your 10 yr. bourbon.
Spicy, would pair well with IPA versus a pale.
thoroughly impressed with this almost no bite at all 4 a 121 proof bourbon...if u see a bottle grab it lol  readily available at frugal macdoogal in Nashville

Batch 02

Got this for $35, I think it may have been mis priced with regular Bulleit?  Anyway, not too familiar with regular bulleit, I’ve tried it some time ago before really getting into bourbon and didn’t care one way or the other, I really just purchased this because of the discounted price.  Boy was I pleasantly surprised. 

Tasted with one cube. I like neat usually but with this proof will add ice.

Smoother than some other barrel proofs that I love, but also still tasty enough to warrant a spot in a BP rotation.

nose: caramel, charred wood
palate: brown sugar, caramel, rye spice. good.
86/100

Higher proof evident but still super smooth. Aroma of toasted marshmallows, oranges, oak and rich whiskey. 
A single ice cube smoothes and softens-enhancing the oak and bringing pepper forward.
Best Bulleit I’ve tried. It’s a solid offering. Best of the bunch.
a little too harsh/strong. not a long linger, but in your face flavor.

Harsh when you first open but a day or two later it’s much easier.  Still really hot, my favorite of all the bulleit line-up now but there are better high proof options.  This is rich, a little deeper sweet than I want but legit.
Brown sugar Carmel woody nose. Hot peppery taste with orange anise backdrop.  Long hot orange finish.

3.75/5

a bit stronger than I'd like, but still smooth finish for high rye mash and high proof bourbon

33 open bottles in my collection ranked through multiple blind tastings.  Counting them down!
  
  #25: Bulleit Barrel Strength.  Kentucky Straight Bourbon.  62.7% ABV.  Batch 5
  Paid $55
  I’m a relative newcomer to the bourbon journey, and I’ll probably replace this with another untried brand’s barrel strength rather than buy another bottle once it’s done.
  
  This is the highest ABV, and also most challenging dram on the list.  Challenging not so much in the complex-and-contemplative sense; but more in the is-this-going-to-give-me-mouth-and-throat-cancer? sense.  Neat, Bulleit BS is potent butterscotch, firewood on fire, and the transition goes from mouthwatering sweet to mouthpuckering dry.  You can add water until this is 40% ABV, it will still burn due to the high rye mashbill, not so much alcohol.  This is almost too sweet and too hot.  These crazy Americans almost make peaty Scotches feel meh.
  
  MARK: 84/100
  
  PREVIOUSLY, ON BATMAN:
  #26: Glenkinchie Distiller’s Edition.  $46.  43%.  2004/2016.  83/100.
  #27: Macallan Sherry Oak. $66.  43%.  12 years.  82/100.
  #28: Eagle Rare.  $37.  45%.  10 years.  80/100.
  #29: Old Pulteney.  $40.  43%.  12 years.  80/100.
  #30: Balvenie DoubleWood.  $50.  43%.  12 years.  78/100.
Cherry oak on nose. Palette is sweet and thick right away then spice hits you like a truck with nice heat. Finish is long and reallllll nice. Tasty :)

Compared to Elijah Craig BP, this just doesn't cut the mustard for me. The high proof and spiciness overpowers most of the flavors and isn't as balanced as the EJBP. Not bad, just not amazing like I was hoping.
Super smooth for a barrel proof expression caramel and baking spices dominate

Batch Number 03 - 

First, I am a Bulleit fan so my review could be a "tad" skewed here. This is Bulleit on 'roids concerning everything (color, flavor, notes, and horsepower (proof)).  However, it really makes a statement as it does not finish with a burn for its high proof (120+) .  I really enjoyed this both neat and with an ice chip. I have batches 02 and 05 yet to try...

Paid $44.99 @ BevMo. Reviewing 2018 batch 2 @ 125.4 proof.

This is one tasty Bourbon. The most striking element is just how darn smooth it is at this high proof. Upon entry you are hit with a big caramel note. Transitions into baking spices on the mid pallette with a lovely long oak, and cocao finish. It tastes just like my raw cocoa nibs! While thisay not pack the flavor punch of ECBP or Stagg Jr, it is far smoother. If you are new to barrel proof bourbon. This is one for you. If you are a fan of ECBP or Stagg Jr, buy this! 4.5/5. Highly Recommended
Spiciest bourbon I’ve ever had. More spice than Stagg Jr, but less robust flavor.  Overall very good especially from Bulleit.

Even at the higher proof, this is syrupy sweet stuff. It just reminds me of the base Maker's Mark with more alcohol. If you like that kind of thing, go for it. For a long time I thought I didn't like bourbon because I didn't like Maker's Mark or Knob Creek. It doesn't even make a very good Old Fashioned. Not to mention the terrible way the owners treated their gay daughter. Don't buy this, go get some Old Grand-Dad 114.
Great bourbon and the palate is much more mellow than the proof.
Palate is oak, vanilla, leather. Some fruit, chocolate, and black pepper too.
I taste some of the richness and get just a hint of fruit, but the heat overwhelms the other flavors
Hints of vanilla at the beginning, hot in the middle, smooth at finish.
If there is such a thing as a “every day barrel proof sipper” this is it.
batch 1. similar to four roses but not as good
Cinnamon, nutmeg, dried fig, dried cherry; finish of light chocolate/caramel, especially on the nose. Great burn.

First tried this at the Bulleit distillery after taking a tour there. This was by far my favorite of the tasting samples. 

I find this to be a very strong burn at first and mellows out to a taste of oak, caramel, and sweet finish. 

4/5
Spicy and rich simultaneously, dry on the gums but tasty all the way
2.5? A little ice helps. I like things neat, but this needs some ice. Kinda rough
Decent flavor. Alcohol content is too high to be smooth.
Probably my favorite Bulleit. Slightly heavy ethanol taste, but the flavors that come out are strong and enjoyable
Much better than the normal variety. This definitely has more kick, more to enjoy
Delicious and fair price. It is not ‘just bulleit’ as some have described, its much better. The proof changes the whole flavor profile. I like it. It will remain a staple at this price
Well worth the buy. The extra octane in this one doesn’t detract from the palate notes at all

Neat Review.
First, was every bit of its high proof. Tons of heat going in and on the palate... spicy.... I really wasn’t feeling it. I did have a second taste later in the evening because I wanted to give it another chance and I’m glad I did. Although it was still hot at the nose, I felt it settled nicely on the palate this time. Still had some heat but not as overpowering... perhaps because it opened up a bit since sitting? Either way, I did enjoy the Bulleit. Would I buy another bottle myself... probably not, but I wouldn’t shy away from it if offered for sure.
Bite and puts hair on chest. Warm feeling. Good buy tho

Definitely a kick here. Strong alcohol smell on the nose. Lots of peppery spice with a dulled vanilla and caramel taste on the front of the tongue. Could tell it’s a barrel strength for sure but very sippable.

Some serious burn on the nose with butterscotch coming through. Moderately spicy and intense. Gets oilier as it sits, almost a citrusy flavored oil to it. One of my favorite moderately priced, relatively easy to find bourbons. Water doesn’t seem to make a huge difference.
Nice burn at initial tasting that lasts a decent amount of time with some nice caramel undertones
VERY sweet at the start. Nice spicy, higher abv finish. Solid entry from Stitzel-Weller.
strong. very strong. strong scent and taste.
Smell the oak and marshmallow. HEAT but mellows very nicely with a cube lots of pepper and anise nice sipper!
Nose, sweet oak. The taste is simple, sweet, oak and cinnamon hot!!! Full body, long finish. Love it!
Smooth but a tad cough syrup like
Thanks Tim! Wow, that there is a whiskey! 6/3/17.

Heat kinda overpowers a lot of this at first but as time or water is added to the equation based on your preference, it opens up nicely. Thought this is most likely just Old Granddad in a different bottle
This is fantastic. Nice warm spices on the front end and then it settles on the palette. I get some cinnamon and spice at the back. So flavorful.

Smells sweet, but not as refined as the 10 year. Heavy spiced notes on the taste.

Bought as part of a flight.

Barrel strength so a drop of water is necessary.  

Honey sweet with a long finish. Bold.
Heavy punch from the high proof.  Overwhelms the taste.
Strong, but with some ice, it’s solid
good but dayum you'll feel it

I have had this bottle for a while now and left it alone for a month or so, had a drink last night

First few sips l had neat, and this guy is good but rough around the edges. Really strong punch upfront, but that is mixed with some good flavor-short lived though. 

Now a little addition of water actually thickened this bourbon up a bit, as weird as that sounds. The flavor really comes out strong, the proof decrease eases the drinkability, and this is now a velvety smooth full bold flavored whiskey. At this price,  I like it, and will recommend a bottle to friends.
lots of flavor! strong first drink

Nose: Stromg black pepper and anise with some cherry after.

Palette: initial blast of alcohol. After the heat subsides, you get some of the black pepper flavor and dark cherry notes.

not a world beater, but very enjoyable. loads of up front & wonderful over the tongue dark sugary sweetness pushed through by the higher proof. the finish falls slightly flat, but adding a cube or a couple drops of water brings the finish roaring through.
Prefer the Bulleit 10 year over this
I really liked the cherry spice flavors I got. Long burn finish. I got it at a value for $30, which makes it a buy. Not at MSRP.
a shot goes great in a cold glass of lemonade.
Stronger nose. Still simular to regular Bulleit.
Vanilla, honey, dates and a touch of oak.
Like normal bullet - but with a better kick.  On rocks - the bite is a little smoother and let’s the flavor mellow a little bit.  Would be good on a cold night by a fire.
Definitely has the marshmallow taste as described and enjoyed it with my petite filet. Had 2 glasses.

The smell is wonderful and you can tell a strong sip is on the way. With ice it is very smooth until the bold flavor really comes in. It is spicy and more flavorful than some of the more higher proof bourbons I have had, but the alcohol burn is also higher.

125 proof shines when tasting neat. The spice is felt the whole way through. (Drink while skiing - the gondola gobbler)
On the rocks the spice mellows a bit in the beginning but spice hits middle through finish. I would drink again but probably not purchase for my own enjoyment unless planned on sharing it with a few friends. (125 proof!!!)
Very strong and spicy. Spice tends to overwhelm other flavors. Not bad to sip slowly.
Didn't get to taste it cut with water, which was disappointing

Nose: Oak, candied orange peel, toasted marshmallow, brown sugar
Palate: Medium bodied.  Lots of chili pepper and oak, with dark chocolate and caramel in the background.  Finishes dry.

This is the bourbon to have someone try if they want to understand what bourbon obsessives mean when they endlessly cite "rye spice" as a note.  Bulleit sources high-rye bourbons for its entire lineup, and this uncut, undiluted version is the spiciest yet, as if infused with anise, cardamom, fennel, and black pepper.  It's also decadently sweet with some good acidity for balance, like an orange marmalade or spiced honey.  This is not a particularly old bourbon, so it doesn't feature many oak or wood notes, but it's a winner.  Let it sit for a few minutes before sipping, as that heavy alcohol punch needs some time to dissipate.  $52 in the gift shop is a great price nowadays for a cask-strength bourbon, so the extra value premium bumps this bottle up in my ratings.  I'm not sure what batch this was, but it was 62.7% ABV.
Hot and spicy with a smooth sweet finish
Oak on the nose. Strong spice on the palette, black pepper, cinnamon, rye. Finish is quick and strong with oak, pepper, anise.
Peppery, sweet, dark fruit, fresh ground pepper. Chewing on oak. Creamy.
Shared this one with a friend and we both enjoyed it. Initially hits with a little bite, flavors linger for a bit and go away leaving a fresh feeling in your mouth.

Small slow sips are very enjoyable neat, hot and peppery with a warming afterburn... would be great in a flask while shoveling snow in the bitter cold!   Add a few ice cubes and out comes a little sweetness and away goes the burn.
Hot, hot, hot and oak. Additional water and or ice needed to tame the whiskey, brings out some vanilla sweetness to it.
First glass was neat...I found the spice a little overwhelming at first but it did grow on me.  I enjoyed it much better on rocks as the ice cooled down the spice a bit.
Very strong. Could tell it was 125 proof
Very strong. You could tell it was 125 proof
One of my favorites. Smoky burnt sugar on the nose and hot and spicy on the tongue. Never disappoints.
Strong start to a smooth finish. Smoky
62.7%.  Batch #2.  Carmel and cinnamon nose. Carmel and charred oak taste.  Obviously lots of heat!   Front of tongue is empty, back of tongue lingers with some cherry notes.
As a whole, bulliet bourbons are decent to me. This one however is a winner. Love the hotness and the punch of flavor.
Very spicy. Leaves nice tingle on the lips. Lots of warm flavors.
Hot.  Cinnamon.  Tons of oak.  Lingering anise.    Not bad but for the price the Russel’s reserve single barrel beats it hands down.

Pleasant nose of caramel, vanilla, peppeer, oak, with a hint of ethanol and burnt popcorn. Hot on attack, burnt popcorn, heavy char, lingering heat and peppery spice. Very rough around the edges. Grainy and hot finish. Not my style.
Powerful flavor, little bit of cinnamon and spice. Sweet like burnt sugar with a hot finish.

Good with ice
A little harsh neat

Nose....Toffee, chocolate, pepper, and a very noticeable buttery scent....

Color....a truly rich mahogany....

Taste....A complex heap of pepper, anise, cinnamon and tobacco come roaring in initially. That is soon followed by a wonderfully sweet taste of dark fruits, butterscotch and vanilla...

Overall....I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase. The fact that it's bottled at 122 proof is truly remarkable. Once it has time to open up it really shines. Suddenly herbal and grassy notes come to fruition. It's quite a bourbon, offering such distinctive yet diverse flavors pour after pour.. Well worth the cost....
Big spice. Love the sweet finish.

The spice and graham cracker which must be the “toasted marshmallow” described is fantastic. The mouthfeel on this being uncut and unfiltered is exactly what I want from a bourbon. Great way for someone to jump into barrel strength bourbon without killing your pocket book. A must buy for any high proof fan.

Nose: charred oak and toasted maple with hints of pepper
Taste: a blast of pepper and spice with notes of maple syrup
Finish: strong and lingering, pepper lasts on the tongue with notes of vanilla and marshmallow complimenting the spice
Really opens up with a splash of water
Batch #05. Smooth, hard hitting, great finish.
Fiery start, but the sweet comes in quick and then a peppery finish

So I’ve been drinking this off and on usually when on sale but felt the need to review it on here.
Nose: so upfront there’s a little bit of ethanol that kind of helps keep the fact that you’re sipping a 60%+ bourbon in mind. 
When pushing past that I get hints of almost orange pledge or peels with after hints of a sweeter scent maybe hints of honey ?
Palate: so surprisingly there’s hardly any burn it’s more orange , rye spice and Caramel.
The finish is nice and long but gentle nothing too too harsh for the proof but you’ll taste it on the exhale for a few breathes for sure. 
Overall I always usually take price into account with overall product because I rarely spend over $60 on a bottle unless I KNOW it’s worth it!
This is a solid 86 given price account and flavor profile ! It’s affordable,packed full of flavor and always available! 
I prefer rare breed over this but not always and sometimes this hits the spot better!if never tried is solidly recommend !

Nose: Oak, leather, alcohol, barrel char.  Peppermint.  Citrus - lemons and mandarins.  Floral.  Black pepper.

Palate: Oak, leather, alcohol.  Char.  Brown sugar and barrel.  Tannin.  Hot.  Prickly alcohol.  Bready undertones.  Long finish - tongue coating oil.  Bananas.

Smell: ethanol of course, with a strong oak smell masking the relatively subtle hints of black pepper, old leather, vanilla, and a bit of maple. 

Tastes similar, very strong flavor, yet pretty drinkable. There’s a slight nuttiness to the flavor. It’s pretty much common straight bourbon flavors with higher rye content, but done well so that you can drink this easily enough for 127 proof. Overall, it’s got very bold flavors, but nice and drinkable, nothing too out of the ordinary on the flavor profile.
Very spicy, hot, rich flavors, hint of smoke.

This smells kind of like citrus fruit and it tastes kind of like it too. There is some nice clean orange with that familiar high proof alcohol. It's sweet with a refreshingly clean alcohol flavor. This may be Bulleit's answer to Knob Creek Single Barrel. The tartness and mineral work really well with the orange, as does the hint of apricot. The barrel is relatively understated, but it is still good. I really enjoy this. Water opens it up a bit, cutting down on that beautiful citrus but bringing out some nice wood. It doesn't have that nice robust aged flavor and endless complexity, but it does have a nice clean flavor with a few things going on. The smoke does elevate it beyond alcohol and balances the sweetness. There's eventually some nuttiness here that I really appreciate. There's some almond, hazelnut, and coconut. If the nuts stood out more, this could be a really amazing bourbon. The complexity eventually becomes quite good, but it takes its time. The spiciness is quite pronounced with a mix of cinnamon and black pepper, as well as maybe a bit of clove, but it is not overwhelming despite being really strong. This is a great drink that is gradually complex and well worth sipping. There might be a hint of maple and something medicinal going on here.

We run blind tastings and this one recently came out on top in a good lineup of previous winners. I am hoping there is some consistency from bottle to bottle. From nose to finish, this one has great sweet and spicy balance.

Tasting alone on the rocks.  Easy to drink, little to no burn, pretty smooth, small lingering aftertaste but pleasant.  Not much of an odor, good or bad. Would have a second glass.. or more.  Favorable.

Vanilla Carmel eucalyptus on nose. Same on palate. Lots of spice in the palate as well. Finish is long. Overall it’s a nice enjoyable sip without a load of complexity but plenty of balance and bite and I like the sweet eucalyptus notes.
Fruity, caramel, smokey, and pretty strong.
Surprisingly smooth for a barrel strength. Silky and sweet, but not much complexity.
On the nose I get charred citrus and oak. The palate gives more of the citrus and spicy oily oak. Nice finish that lingers.

Nose of ethanol, wet oak, more ethanol, some leather and spice but nothing rich or warm which I would expect for such a high proof.  Palate is hot and thin but more vanilla and oak than the nose would suggest.  Not terrible but seems too thin for the proof and much better options out there for the $.
Lots of vanilla. Very smooth. Easy drinking.
Bold smoky oak and notes of vanilla and spice
